int64.description: AS number to prepend to the AS Path attributes.

bool.description: Clear the AS path to make it empty.

list.description: Replace the existing AS path with a new AS_SEQUENCE containing the listed AS numbers.
List of community sets to add to the route.
List of community sets to remove from the route.
List of community sets to replace the existing communities with. Cannot be combined with Add or Remove.

single_nested.description: Modify BGP communities associated with the route using hybrid Community Sets.

int64.description: Set a new LOCAL_PREF value for matching BGP routes.
Fixed numerical value to set or add/subtract.

string.description: The operation to perform on the MED value.
Use a fixed value or an IGP metric to adjust the MED.

single_nested.description: Set a new MED value.

string.description: Set a new ORIGIN attribute for matching BGP routes.

single_nested.description: Actions related to the BGP protocol.

string.description: Final disposition for the route.

single_nested.description: The default action to apply if no other actions are defined.

single_nested.description: Policy defines a set of rules and actions to manage network traffic or routing behavior, with statements that include matching conditions and actions, such as accepting or rejecting routes, or modifying route attributes like BGP parameters.
PolicyStatus defines the observed state of Policy.

string.description: name of the PrefixSet
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
the namespace scope in which to operate

int64.description: The end range when using a range to match prefixes.

bool.description: Indicates if it is an exact match. Ignores the StartRange and EndRange if this param is set.

string.description: The IPv4 or IPv6 prefix in CIDR notation with mask.

int64.description: If specifying a range, this is the start of the range.

list_nested.description: List of IPv4 or IPv6 prefixes in CIDR notation.

single_nested.description: PrefixSet defines a collection of IP prefixes, which may include specific CIDR blocks or a range of prefixes. This set is typically used for matching routes or implementing routing policies.
PrefixSetStatus defines the observed state of PrefixSet.
